summary: Transforms raw Illumina sequencing data into an unmapped SAM or BAM file.

arguments.summary: Which adapters to look for in the read.
arguments.name: --ADAPTERS_TO_CHECK

options.summary:
The following sequences can be found in
        https://support.illumina.com/content/dam/illumina-support/documents/documentation/chemistry_documentation/experiment-design/illumina-adapter-sequences_1000000002694-01.pdf
        and are protected by the following copyright notice:

        Oligonucleotide sequences (c) 2016 Illumina, Inc. All rights reserved. Derivative works created by
        Illumina customers are authorized for use with Illumina instruments and products only. All other
        uses are strictly prohibited.
options.name: PAIRED_END

arguments.summary: Apply EAMSS filtering to identify inappropriately quality scored bases towards the ends of reads and convert their quality scores to Q2.
arguments.name: --APPLY_EAMSS_FILTER

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Deprecated (use LIBRARY_PARAMS).  Tab-separated file for creating all output BAMs for barcoded run with single IlluminaBasecallsToSam invocation.  Columns are BARCODE, OUTPUT, SAMPLE_ALIAS, and LIBRARY_NAME.  Row with BARCODE=N is used to specify a file for no barcode match
arguments.name: --BARCODE_PARAMS

arguments.summary: When should the sample barcode (as read by the sequencer) be placed on the reads in the BC tag?
arguments.name: --BARCODE_POPULATION_STRATEGY

options.summary: Put barcodes only into the records that were not assigned to any declared barcode.
options.name: ORPHANS_ONLY

options.summary: Put barcodes into records for which an exact match with a declared barcode was not found.
options.name: INEXACT_MATCH

options.summary: Put barcodes into all the records.
options.name: ALWAYS

arguments.summary: The barcodes directory with _barcode.txt files (generated by ExtractIlluminaBarcodes). If not set, use BASECALLS_DIR.
arguments.name: --BARCODES_DIR

arguments.summary: The basecalls directory.
arguments.name: --BASECALLS_DIR

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create an index when writing VCF or coordinate sorted BAM output.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: If set, this is the first tile to be processed (used for debugging).  Note that tiles are not processed in numerical order.
arguments.name: --FIRST_TILE

arguments.summary: For specifying adapters other than standard Illumina
arguments.name: --FIVE_PRIME_ADAPTER

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: Whether to ignore reads whose barcodes are not found in LIBRARY_PARAMS.  Useful when outputting BAMs for only a subset of the barcodes in a lane.
arguments.name: --IGNORE_UNEXPECTED_BARCODES

arguments.summary: Should the barcode quality be included when the sample barcode is included?
arguments.name: --INCLUDE_BARCODE_QUALITY

arguments.summary: Whether to include the barcode information in the @RG->BC header tag. Defaults to false until included in the SAM spec.
arguments.name: --INCLUDE_BC_IN_RG_TAG

arguments.summary: Whether to include non-PF reads
arguments.name: --INCLUDE_NON_PF_READS

arguments.summary: Lane number. This can be specified multiple times. Reads with the same index in multiple lanes will be added to the same output file. Each lane is represented by a separate read group
arguments.name: --LANE

arguments.summary: Deprecated (use LIBRARY_PARAMS).  The name of the sequenced library
arguments.name: --LIBRARY_NAME

arguments.summary: Tab-separated file for creating all output BAMs for a lane with single IlluminaBasecallsToSam invocation.  The columns are OUTPUT, SAMPLE_ALIAS, and LIBRARY_NAME, BARCODE_1, BARCODE_2 ... BARCODE_X where X = number of barcodes per cluster (optional).  Row with BARCODE_1 set to 'N' is used to specify a file for no barcode match.  You may also provide any 2 letter RG header attributes (excluding PU, CN, PL, and DT)  as columns in this file and the values for those columns will be inserted into the RG tag for the BAM file created for a given row.
arguments.name: --LIBRARY_PARAMS

arguments.summary: Configure SortingCollections to store this many records before spilling to disk. For an indexed run, each SortingCollection gets this value/number of indices. Deprecated: use `MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM`
arguments.name: --MAX_READS_IN_RAM_PER_TILE

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: The minimum quality (after transforming 0s to 1s) expected from reads.  If qualities are lower than this value, an error is thrown.The default of 2 is what the Illumina's spec describes as the minimum, but in practice the value has been observed lower.
arguments.name: --MINIMUM_QUALITY

arguments.summary: The tag to use to store any molecular index base qualities.  If more than one molecular index is found, their qualities will be concatenated and stored here (.i.e. the number of "M" operators in the READ_STRUCTURE)
arguments.name: --MOLECULAR_INDEX_BASE_QUALITY_TAG

arguments.summary: The tag to use to store any molecular indexes.  If more than one molecular index is found, they will be concatenated and stored here.
arguments.name: --MOLECULAR_INDEX_TAG

arguments.summary: The number of threads to run in parallel. If NUM_PROCESSORS = 0, number of cores is automatically set to the number of cores available on the machine. If NUM_PROCESSORS < 0, then the number of cores used will be the number available on the machine less NUM_PROCESSORS.
arguments.name: --NUM_PROCESSORS

arguments.summary: Deprecated (use LIBRARY_PARAMS).  The output SAM or BAM file. Format is determined by extension.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: The name of the sequencing technology that produced the read.
arguments.name: --PLATFORM

arguments.summary: If set, process only the tile number given and prepend the tile number to the output file name.
arguments.name: --PROCESS_SINGLE_TILE

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: ID used to link RG header record with RG tag in SAM record.  If these are unique in SAM files that get merged, merge performance is better.  If not specified, READ_GROUP_ID will be set to <first 5 chars of RUN_BARCODE>.<LANE> .
arguments.name: --READ_GROUP_ID

arguments.summary:
A description of the logical structure of clusters in an Illumina Run, i.e. a description of the structure IlluminaBasecallsToSam assumes the  data to be in. It should consist of integer/character pairs describing the number of cycles and the type of those cycles (B for Sample Barcode, M for molecular barcode, T for Template, and S for skip).  E.g. If the input data consists of 80 base clusters and we provide a read structure of "28T8M8B8S28T" then the sequence may be split up into four reads:
* read one with 28 cycles (bases) of template
* read two with 8 cycles (bases) of molecular barcode (ex. unique molecular barcode)
* read three with 8 cycles (bases) of sample barcode
* 8 cycles (bases) skipped.
* read four with 28 cycles (bases) of template
The skipped cycles would NOT be included in an output SAM/BAM file or in read groups therein.
arguments.name: --READ_STRUCTURE

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: The barcode of the run.  Prefixed to read names.
arguments.name: --RUN_BARCODE

arguments.summary: The start date of the run.
arguments.name: --RUN_START_DATE

arguments.summary: Deprecated (use LIBRARY_PARAMS).  The name of the sequenced sample
arguments.name: --SAMPLE_ALIAS

arguments.summary: The name of the sequencing center that produced the reads.  Used to set the @RG->CN header tag.
arguments.name: --SEQUENCING_CENTER

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: If true, the output records are sorted by read name. Otherwise they are unsorted.
arguments.name: --SORT

arguments.summary: The list of tags to store each molecular index.  The number of tags should match the number of molecular indexes.
arguments.name: --TAG_PER_MOLECULAR_INDEX

arguments.summary: For specifying adapters other than standard Illumina
arguments.name: --THREE_PRIME_ADAPTER

arguments.summary: If set, process no more than this many tiles (used for debugging).
arguments.name: --TILE_LIMIT

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
IlluminaBasecallsToSam transforms a lane of Illumina data file formats (bcl, locs, clocs, qseqs, etc.) into
 SAM or BAM file format.
 <p/>
 In this application, barcode data is read from Illumina data file groups, each of which is associated with a tile.
 Each tile may contain data for any number of barcodes, and a single barcode's data may span multiple tiles.  Once the
 barcode data is collected from files, each barcode's data is written to its own SAM/BAM.  The barcode data must be
 written in order; this means that barcode data from each tile is sorted before it is written to file, and that if a
 barcode's data does span multiple tiles, data collected from each tile must be written in the order of the tiles
 themselves.
 <p/>
 This class employs a number of private subclasses to achieve this goal.  The TileReadAggregator controls the flow
 of operation.  It is fed a number of Tiles which it uses to spawn TileReaders.  TileReaders are responsible for
 reading Illumina data for their respective tiles from disk, and as they collect that data, it is fed back into the
 TileReadAggregator.  When a TileReader completes a tile, it notifies the TileReadAggregator, which reviews what was
 read and conditionally queues its writing to disk, baring in mind the requirements of write-order described in the
 previous paragraph.  As writes complete, the TileReadAggregator re-evaluates the state of reads/writes and may queue
 more writes.  When all barcodes for all tiles have been written, the TileReadAggregator shuts down.
 <p/>
 The TileReadAggregator controls task execution using a specialized ThreadPoolExecutor.  It accepts special Runnables
 of type PriorityRunnable which allow a priority to be assigned to the runnable.  When the ThreadPoolExecutor is
 assigning threads, it gives priority to those PriorityRunnables with higher priority values.  In this application,
 TileReaders are assigned lowest priority, and write tasks are assigned high priority.  It is designed in this fashion
 to minimize the amount of time data must remain in memory (write the data as soon as possible, then discard it from
 memory) while maximizing CPU usage.
name: IlluminaBasecallsToSam (Picard)
